Question: I have been told I have COPD. I have been having problems for 2 months. I am now having trouble coughing until I throw up, I am on Advair, Albuterol, Sinus medicine, and Mucus relief. Is there anything that will stop this coughing. My bronchial tubes are very sore.
Answer: COPD causes airway inflammation and increased sputum production, worsened by infection. Antibiotics may be needed if infection is present. Enroll in a pulmonary rehabilitation program for chest physiotherapy and deep breathing exercises to clear secretions. Consider adding an expectorant like N-acetylcysteine (NAC) or guaifenesin.

The treatment of cough depends upon cause of it. For URI, LRIs, PNC, GERD, TB, HF, PCM, PAIN, ASTHMA, COMPUTERS, BP, CHEST INFECTIONS, PNEUMONIA, EFFUSION, CANCER, REFLUX DISEASE, TB, LUNG CANCER, HEART FAILURE, PULMONARY TO BOOST THE IMMUNITY OF BODY AND REDUCING ALLERGIES, ANTIHISTAMINE TABLETS SHOULD BE USED. Question: I recently went to the ER for severe coughing due to mountain cedar which triggered my asthma. I was given a breathing treatment and Doxycycline Hyclate 100mg cap. Every since I started taking the antibiotic I have had severe headaches with a lot of pressure. I have had only about 5 hrs of sleep in 4 days due to the pressure and headache worsening when I lay down. Any suggestions why I'm getting like this?
Answer: Headache is a known side effect of doxycycline, often resolving after discontinuation. Reduce salt intake to lessen pressure. If symptoms persist, consult your doctor to adjust the antibiotic.
Model_Answer: Hello! Welcome on Chat Doctor ! Your symptoms could be related to an underlying sinusitis. For that reason, I would recommend performing some tests : -a nasal endoscopy-complete blood count (CBC)-blood electrolytes-fasting glucose-uric acid levels. An abdominal ultrasound should also be performed. A chest Xray study might help exclude pulmonary causes. If these tests result normal, you may need to take anti histamines such as loratadine or cetirizine. Hope you will find this answer helpful! Kind regards,

Question: Hi doctor, I have candida balanoposthitis. I consulted a doctor, and he gave me Glospor DS 200 mg for a week with Livafin ointment. But still, I am having red spots on the penis. My penis is uncircumcised. Please provide your suggestion.
Answer: Persistent red spots may indicate incomplete resolution of candida infection. Continue antifungal treatment (e.g., fluconazole orally and topical clotrimazole) for 2-4 weeks. Maintain hygiene by retracting the foreskin and cleaning daily. If no improvement, test for diabetes or reassess for other infections.
Model_Answer: HelloThanks for writing to Chat Doctor. Your symptoms suggest that you may be suffering from fungal infection of genitals (Candidiasis). It can occur due to poor hygiene practices during bath/sexual intercourse. The treatment involves antifungal medicines such as Fluconazole tablets(150mg) once daily along with topical antifungal cream containing clotrimazole. Ensure proper personal hygiene by using condom during sex. Avoid sexual encounters till complete recovery. Get well soonRegards Chat Doctor.

Question: Hi. Im just wondering because i forgot to take my birth control pill 2 times in 8 days, iv been jumping over my period like 4 times, so i get a little bleeding(is this dangerous?), and i had sex yesterday, do you think the risk for pregnancy is there?? if it is, is it too late to take the morning after pill??
Answer: Missing pills increases pregnancy risk, especially with recent unprotected sex. Breakthrough bleeding is common but not dangerous. Take an emergency contraceptive pill within 72 hours of intercourse. Resume regular pills and use backup contraception for 7 days.
Model_Answer: Hello, Thanks for writing here. I have gone through your question. Your concern is regarding missed pills of contraception. It can lead to failure of contraceptive method. If you did not ovulate then no need to worry as conception will be prevented. But if you took tablet regularly then you should go for emergency pill within 72 hours of unprotected intercourse. This has high success rate but still it needs to be taken properly according to instructions. Hope I answered your question. Would be happy to help you further. Take care.

Question: I am male 28, on my infertility work up diagnosed with bilateral grade 2 varicocele, i had semen analysis 4 to 5 times. at first 40 million motility normal after sperm count decreasing to 25, 15, 20, 05 in further tests with all normal motility. i have no stress and psychological problems, all my hormonal reports lh,fsh,TT,TF, prolactin are normal but having elevated E2 is 92.29 pg/ml, having good erections but suffering low libido and no that much pleasure in intercourse and while ejaculating. what to i do now doctor suggested surgery for varicocele is it required for bilateral grade 2?
Answer: Varicocele surgery may not reverse declining sperm counts but can halt progression. Elevated estradiol (E2) could explain low libido; consider an aromatase inhibitor. Assisted reproductive techniques (e.g., IUI or IVF) are viable options. Add clomiphene, CoQ10, and lycopene to support sperm health.
Model_Answer: Hi, Varicoceles can be treated by either open surgical repair or laparoscopically (keyhole). Laparoscopy has become the procedure of choice as it minimizes postoperative pain and shortens recovery time. The success rate following keyhole surgery is very high. Hope this helpsRegards Chat Doctor.

Question: I've had a root canal treatment on a tooth for the second time-the first root canal was three years ago-I was suffering with tenderness above the tooth for over a year, had my dentist check it and he couldn't see anything on x ray-about six weeks ago I had an infection in the tooth and had to have the root canal re-done-after my dentist had drained the infection, the pain subsided after a day or so and completely went after a few days. Question: My MRI shows a left mid pole lateral cortical renal cyst (12 mm) and it also mentions left upper pole simple renal cortical cyst (10 mm). Are these the same cyst looking from different angles on the MRI, or are they two different ones. Also, what would the treatment be, if any?
Answer: These are likely two distinct simple renal cysts, common and benign in many adults. No treatment is needed unless they cause symptoms (e.g., pain or obstruction). Monitor with periodic ultrasound.
Model_Answer: Hello! Thank you for asking at Chat Doctor! I carefully read your question and understand your concern. Cysts of kidneys can occur in various sizes and numbers. They do not cause symptoms unless grow very large or rupture. If there is no clinical evidence that this lesions produce pain or bleeding then we should consider them benign. The best way to treat such cases is observation with ultrasound imaging every six months. Hope to have been helpful! Best wishes,

Question: I had a c-section with my first pregnancy 19 years ago. I am concerned if I am able to have a VBAC delivery with my second pregnancy since my first pregnancy resulted in an emergency C-section. Also, I am 48. What are the risks of pregnancy in women over 40?
Answer: VBAC is possible but depends on prior C-section reason, uterine scar integrity, and current pregnancy factors. Risks over 40 include chromosomal abnormalities, hypertension, diabetes, and miscarriage. Preconception counseling and ultrasound are recommended.
Model_Answer: Hi, Welcome to Chat Doctor .I understand your concern. The decision regarding mode of delivery after previous cesarean section depends upon various factors such as type of incision made during previous surgery, reason for it, interval period between two deliveries, current obstetric history including age, weight, BMI, parity, gestational status, fetal presentation, growth parameters, maternal serum screening tests(AFP), ultrasound findings, etc. Please discuss these issues with your treating gynecologist/obstetrician who would be better judge of them. Hope this helps you. Wish you good health. Thanks & Regards.

Question: My name is roxann I am 29 trying to get pregnant I have a 12 year old daughter, I caught chlamydia 5 years ago and my tubes are blocked, I just did a laparoscopy surgery 3 weeks ago my right tube is completely damaged and my left tube is blocked they managed to clear the left tube but I still want to know my chances of getting pregnant and how long it going to take?

Question: My wife recently got pregnant.
